Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric has a partially black core, interior flecked with a brown resinous material, exterior covered with a buff-coloured slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.190)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36453) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36453)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 312 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
